fields.summary: CC keeps getting marked as shut down.
fields.environment: Installed from source build on new QA cluster using CentOS 6.3. Non-HA installation.

comments.body: If you see this again, please contact Dima so he can take a look.
I've had this happen to me a dozen or more times recently. Next time it happens, I'll ping you so you can poke at it live.

I see the following messages being repeated numerous times every time I issue a "service eucalyptus-cc cleanrestart". Using restart, start, stop does not trigger the behavior. Its only when pre-pended with 'clean'. I haven't seen it yet where the cc unexpectedly restart without me causing it directly.

{code}
2013-04-26 09:01:32 DEBUG 000012242 init_thread              | init=1 0x7f9cf15fc000 0x7f9c93521000 0x7f9cca168000 0x7f9cc9f61000
2013-04-26 09:01:32 DEBUG 000012242 initialize               | pMeta: userId=admin correlationId=shutdowncorrid
2013-04-26 09:01:32 DEBUG 000012242 doShutdownService        | invoked: userId=admin
2013-04-26 09:01:33 DEBUG 000012133 vnetApplySingleTableRule | applying single table (nat) rule (-D PREROUTING -d 169.254.169.254/32 -p tcp -m tcp --dport 80 -j DNAT --to-destination 10.111.5.31:8773)
2013-04-26 09:01:33 DEBUG 000012133 vnetApplySingleTableRule | applying single table (filter) rule (-F)
2013-04-26 09:01:33 DEBUG 000012133 vnetApplySingleTableRule | applying single table (nat) rule (-F)
2013-04-26 09:01:33 DEBUG 000012133 vnetApplySingleTableRule | applying single table (filter) rule (-P FORWARD ACCEPT)
2013-04-26 09:01:33  INFO 000012133 ccCheckState             | this cluster controller marked as shut down
2013-04-26 09:01:33 ERROR 000012133 monitor_thread           | ccCheckState() returned failures
2013-04-26 09:01:34  WARN 000012133 vnetUnsetMetadataRedirec | cloudIp is not yet set, not installing redirect rule
2013-04-26 09:01:34 DEBUG 000012133 vnetApplySingleTableRule | applying single table (filter) rule (-F)
2013-04-26 09:01:34 DEBUG 000012133 vnetApplySingleTableRule | applying single table (nat) rule (-F)
2013-04-26 09:01:34 DEBUG 000012133 vnetApplySingleTableRule | applying single table (filter) rule (-P FORWARD ACCEPT)
2013-04-26 09:01:34  INFO 000012133 ccCheckState             | this cluster controller marked as shut down
{code}

I've seen it during migration activity.

Next time I encounter it, I won't restart the CLC and instead will seek you out so that you can poke at it.
Great info. Thanks Jeff.

Would [~decker] mind commenting on possible correlations between changes in CLC related to migration and an unsolicited {{doShutdownService}} request being sent, apparently non-deterministically, to a CC, roughly around the time when migrations are being performed?

To follow up a bit:

# All state changes go through {{ccChangeState}}.
# The only call-site which passes {{SHUTDOWNCC}} as the {{newState}} to {{ccChangeState}} is in {{doShutdownService}}.
# All call-sites for {{ccChangeState}} pass an explicit enum value -- and not some computed value.
# The message type corresponding to {{doShutdownService}} is not defined in the CLC.

[~vasya] has seen a slightly different case with the same symptoms (CC randomly becomes disabled, but can be enabled when CLC is restarted). Here is the sequence of Service invocations, from the cc.log:

{code}
